trans-unit.source: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, background tasks require certain conditions to be met, in addition to the event that triggers the task, so that the background task can succeed.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, background tasks require certain conditions to be met, in addition to the event that triggers the task, so that the background task can succeed.

trans-unit.source: You can specify one or more of the conditions specified by [**SystemConditionType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224835) when registering your background task.
trans-unit.target: You can specify one or more of the conditions specified by [**SystemConditionType**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224835) when registering your background task.

trans-unit.source: The condition will be checked after the trigger has been fired; the background task will be queued, but it will not run until all the required conditions are satisfied.
trans-unit.target: The condition will be checked after the trigger has been fired; the background task will be queued, but it will not run until all the required conditions are satisfied.

trans-unit.source: Putting conditions on background tasks saves battery life and CPU runtime by preventing tasks from running unnecessarily.
trans-unit.target: Putting conditions on background tasks saves battery life and CPU runtime by preventing tasks from running unnecessarily.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your background task runs on a timer and requires Internet connectivity, add the **InternetAvailable** condition to the [**TaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768) before registering the task.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your background task runs on a timer and requires Internet connectivity, add the **InternetAvailable** condition to the [**TaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768) before registering the task.

trans-unit.source: This will help prevent the task from using system resources and battery life unnecessarily by letting it run when the timer has elapsed and the Internet is available.
trans-unit.target: This will help prevent the task from using system resources and battery life unnecessarily by letting it run when the timer has elapsed and the Internet is available.

trans-unit.source: **Note** It is possible to combine multiple conditions by calling AddCondition multiple times on the same [**TaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768).
trans-unit.target: **Note** It is possible to combine multiple conditions by calling AddCondition multiple times on the same [**TaskBuilder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224768).

trans-unit.source: Take care not to add conflicting conditions, such as **UserPresent** and **UserNotPresent**.
trans-unit.target: Take care not to add conflicting conditions, such as **UserPresent** and **UserNotPresent**.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Universal Windows apps must call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) before registering any of the background trigger types.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call [**RemoveAccess**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700471) and then call [**RequestAccessAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700485) when your app launches after being updated.
